recipe.title: Cider Glaze

meta.note: This is like Confectioner's Glaze, but made with boiled-down apple cider. Use to glaze Cider Donuts.

steps.step: Combine the cider and granulated sugar in a small saucepan.
Heat, stirring frequently, until the sugar dissolves. The mixture needs to get hot but need not go to a full boil.
Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.
Sift in confectioner's sugar. Beat ingredients together until a smooth glaze forms.
Add small amounts water if needed to yield a glaze that flows but isn't too thin.

recipe.serving: Warm glaze slightly over hot water to increase fluidity. Dip pastries into glaze, or pour over pastry, and allow to dry to a thin shell.
